comment.author: 23623601@N03
comment._content: Please see stumblng.tumblr.com/post/25897718, where I've written a mini-essay about this photo.

comment.author: 8716770@N08
comment._content: Poster by College Equal Suffrage League which was founded in 1906 to attract younger women to the Suffrage Cause.

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: This same photo is in the 2005 "Women Who Dare" desk calendar from the Library of Congress, with the subject identified as Susan Walker FItzgerald (1871-1943); she majored in political science at Bryn Mawr, founded the Student Government Association, campaigned for women's suffrage, and was one of the first two women elected to the Massachusetts House of Representatives.

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content:
Fitzgerald portrait elsewhere in the Commons uploads:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2850362011/]

comment.author: 95858546@N00
comment._content:
Why...there you are Mary Poppins! Where the children really so horrible that you quit your day job?

(Ironically Woman's suffrage was an underlying theme of Mary Poppins)

comment.author: 41106620@N04
comment._content: Hi, we are a group dedicated to photos of typo/graphic posters and it would be a pleasure to have this photo in our showcase: typo/graphic posters

comment.author: 77363298@N00
comment._content: Go get 'em , sister! What an amazing time this would have been to live in.
